entry.title: Factor editing: Use AuthSessionStorage instead of QuickUnlockStorage
entry.content:
Change the way how UserContext is stored to authorize cryptohome

operations triggered during OOBE / from os://settings.



This change switches storage from Profile-based QuickUnlockStorage

to system-wide AuthSessionStorage, that would allow storing and using

UserContext before profile is loaded (e.g. as a part of User Recovery

flow).



Bug: b:238606050, b:239681292

entry.title: Only add trailing border/padding to the right fragment, part 2.
entry.content:
I tried to do this in CL:4345873, but that didn't cover all the cases.

If the node being laid out is a formatting context root, floats may also

play a role, so just looking for in-flow breaks inside isn't sufficient

in such cases.



When printing, adding trailing border/padding incorrectly caused

monolithic overflow. If there was something tall monolithic inside as

well, we'd keep on breaking before it indefinitely, because the

monolithic overflow on the container provided a break opportunity.



Bug: 1468664

Change-Id: I0e0c8c47deba4ffa611157497bc639f3c268836f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4746460

entry.title: saved_desks: Fix missing cursor in SavedDeskNameView
entry.content:
This CL fixes a regression that caused the text cursor to become

invisible in the text field that is used to edit names of saved desks.



The cursor was invisible because Textfield::ShouldShowCursor was

returning false. It was doing so because the bounds of the cursor was

not entirely within the bounds of the text view.



The reason why the cursor didn't fit into the bounds was that the height

we set for the text field was too low, given its font. This is a

regression that likely happened when the font size was increased.



Rather than manually tweaking the size of the text field, I opted to

scrap the manual size setting. Now we simply let the textfield size

itself. The practical effect of this is that the name entry is slightly

taller (so the cursor can show). This will also make it more robust to

future size changes.



BUG=b:291833109



Change-Id: Id5080a40b47d40560c218e5c27fcb6b339b2707d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742188

Reviewed-by: Yongshun Liu

Commit-Queue: Daniel Andersson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179129}

entry.title: [iOS] Log omnibox device switcher result
entry.content:
Add logging for device switcher result.

DeviceSwitcherResult are checked at every startup and when the users

leaves NTP on FRE. The result determines the default omnibox position.



When result are not available, log the status:

- NotNewUser: device switcher result are not checked.

- Unavailable: device switcher result are not available.

When the result are available, log the resulting omnibox position:

- TopOmnibox: user has the top omnibox by default

- BottomOmnibox: user has the bottom omnibox by default.

entry.title: [iOS][BVC] Fix footer size update
entry.content:
When updating the toolbar size in updateToolbarState: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/browser_view/browser_view_controller.mm;l=1935-1942;drc=ad247066d1792cf0504836650bf78802f4974a07

Toolbar size are updated in sequence:

1. update collapsed size.

2. update expanded size.

Each update triggers a updateFootersForFullscreenProgress in browser.



There is a mismatch between the toolbar size in browser and fullscreen

during the first update as the expanded size is up to date in browser

but not in fullscreen. The current implementation of

updateFootersForFullscreenProgress computes:

- the expanded toolbar size using the browser value.

- the toolbar size delta using the fullscreen value.



This CL use the expanded toolbar size from fullscreen to avoid the

mismatch.



Bug: None

entry.title: Add URL pattern behavior features to UKM.
entry.content:
In the event we see non-trivial triggering of these, we'd like to be

able to identify common sites which encounter them so that we can

diagnose whether they are benign or not.



The underlying feature has not yet reached a channel with enough usage

to directly evaluate its prevalence, but it should be used no more

frequently than V8URLPattern_Constructor (<.05%) and

SpeculationRulesDocumentRules (<.002%), so it seems virtually certain to

be well under 1%.



Since this usage might not occur on page load, this is expected to be

more reliable than HTTP Archive for making this evaluation.

entry.title: [ios][up] User policies for signed in only users without sync
entry.content:
Make user policies available for signed in only users that explicitly

enable the feature with the flag.



FEATURE GATED BEHIND A FLAG.



The goal of this CL is to start the integration of User Policy to

the sign-in only flow, making it testable, but isn't yet fully

ready for prod.



As the authentication flow isn't yet fulled ready to handle signed in

only accounts (e.g. no "your account is managed prompt"), it is

imperative to gate the feature behind a flag.



This CL split User Policy in 2 groups between users that have Sync

turned ON and users that are only signed in with Sync turned OFF. The

feature is controlled for each group with a designated feature flag.



The split is needed because sign in only and Sync flows aren't yet

unified and are currently slightly different (e.g. not managed account

dialog for sign-in only flow).



Hence, 2 feature flags are needed to handle the transition from Sync

to sign-in only as we expect to have users in both groups for

some time.



Enabling the feature for users with Sync turned ON also enables the

feature for users that are only signed in, which is fine and wanted,

as client that still support and use Sync will be gradually migrated

to sign-in only, hence they won't lose the User Policy feature in

the process.

entry.title: [iOS] Change MultiRowContainerView's alignment to Fill.
entry.content:
All Magic Stack modules that use MultiRowContainerView are designed for

their rows to fill up all available horizontal space.



Currently, this is hard to achieve with UIStackViews because

MultiRowContainerView's alignment is Leading instead of Fill.



This change updates MultiRowContainerView's alignment, which enables

clients to easily create rows that fill the available horizontal space.

entry.title: Implement reporting soft nav INP to UKM
entry.content:
This CL implements reporting soft nav INP and INP before soft nav to

UKM.



The idea is the user interaction data on the renderer side does not

change. On the browser side, this data, in addition to be updated as

the page load user interaction data, as it is currently, would also be

updating a new soft_nav_interval_normalized_responsiveness_ which is

the user interaction data for soft nav intervals.



The first soft nav interval is the period from the page load start to

the time when the 1st soft nav happens. This would be recorded in the

ukm as INP before soft nav. Other soft nav intervals are the period between 2 soft navigations or the page load end(the last interval).

These would be recorded as soft nav INP.



The privacy review is

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FGk4lqfJvuiGCbB3TL7xS0PGYJnX-mmSmm1kDyDL1Wg/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-abA8bYWJi2R1kC2K1xy0RQ



Bug: 1468396

Change-Id: Ib676cd825a59c4f3695ca0eecab6c584c36452b2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727803

Reviewed-by: Michal Mocny

entry.title: kiosk: move <id>.pem files for kiosk test apps to app source directory
entry.content:
It was done with the following steps:

1) In `webstore/downloads` directory there were .crx and

.pem files.

2) Unarchive each .crx file to get the app code to match it with

source codes in `apps_and_extension/` directory. After that step

each app source directory has associated id.

3) Each app source code has `key.pem` file, but there is also .pem

file in `webstore/downloads`. To find the right private key file,

pack the extension with the source code and a potential .pem file

in chrome://extensions page. It will create a new crx file.

4) Add the created crx file to the chrome://extensions to check that

it has the same id.

5) Choose the .pem file with the right id. In all cases the right .pem

file was one from `downloads/` directory.



Fixed: b/281978842

entry.title: Correct expiration strings
entry.content:
Zero days, [0,1), until expiration means that the exception will expire

today. One day, [1,2), means the exception will expire tomorrow. [2,3)

expires in 2 days, etc. The string represents the day on which

expiration happens, not the actual amount of time until expiration.



Added a unit test to the function that computes how many days so this is

more obvious and doesn't regress.



Screenshots don't need to be updated since the uploaded screenshot

contains the "tomorrow" variant, which remains in use.



Bug: 1446230

entry.title: [ios] Fix incognito policy bypass
entry.content:
It was possible to bypass the incognito policy with the new tab button

in the tab switcher and with the physical keyboard.



This CL also fixes the mock calls verification in

key_commands_provider_unittest.mm and fixes a CHECK crash when

using the force incognito policy in combination with the inactive tabs

feature.



This CL introduces a TabGridSwitcherMediator to take over the business

logic, making testing easier. Only the logic that concerns the changes

was moved. We could move more business logic to the mediator as we make

changes on tab grid switcher.

entry.title: Remove suggestion trigger source parameter from DidShowSuggestions().
entry.content:
This reverts half of crrev.com/c/4733376. Turns out it's not needed

after all. Instead of having a manual fallback specific metric (which

requires the trigger source), it was decided [1] to have a metric for

ac=unrecognized fields. This is preferable, because it works for

desktop (manual fallbacks) and mobile (where as of the upcoming launch,

keyboard accessory chips are shown independently of the autocomplete

attribute). This information can be derived from the triggering field.

See crrev.com/c/4747739 for a draft.



The CL isn't reverted completely, because the simplification from

DidShowSuggestions(/*has_autofill_suggestions=*/true) to

DidShowAutofillSuggestions() seems worth keeping (especially in

autofill_metrics_unittest.cc).



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.4q6kyji0si8l

entry.title: [Telemetry] Fix EventManager app UI tracking logic
entry.content:
Use WebContentsObserver instead of TabStripModelObserver to track the

app UI status. There are several issue in the original implementation.

First, the insert event doesn't work because the tab is not ready when

inserted and there won't be committed url. Second, tab status is not

equal to WebContents status. A tab could change its URL or being removed

by drag and drop action. Finally, it doesn't check the secure state.



The new implementation does the following:

* Use the same logic from ApiGuardDelegate to make sure they are

aligned. This make sure not secure tab is not counted.

* After finding an app UI, use WebContentsObserver to track it until it

is closed. Note that this also handles the case that a tab navigates

to another site (the tab won't be removed in this case).

* When the app UI is closed, try to find another instead of cutting the

observers. This allows multiple app UI opening at the same time. This

might be necessary for the potential IWA migration.



Bug: b:291082959

Change-Id: I00b5619b9b5562009d219aef8588d5cd97dd02e3

entry.title: [enrollment] Fix network status tracking for state determination.
entry.content:
AutoEnrollmentClient used to track network state changes to retry

state determination when device goes back online. It used

NetworkConnectionTracker which is detects less changes than

NetworkStateHandler.



Move network state tracking to the controller so it can retrigger both

the client and EnrollmentStateFetcher which does not track network. This

way the client and the fetcher behave identical and are retried outside.



Use NetworkStateHandler (same as AutoEnrollmentCheckScreen and other

OOBE screens) to track device going online.



State determination is launched before AutoEnrollmentCheckScreen

is shown so the controller has to track network state to retry as

the screen is not always there to initiate retry. Ideally, all network

tracking should be moved to the controller and auto-retries should come

from the controller. The screen should only act on network state and

state determination progress.



For now, it is safe to retry from both the controller and the screen.

The controller and the client will retry on the first trigger, and will

ignore any consequent triggers while in-progress.



Bug: b:291866545

Test: CQ

Change-Id: Ib802f3eef98d3ae645b335d9c6c41d403f5b06b2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701209

entry.title: [SDA] Fix crash when resolving inset with an unattached subject
entry.content:
When resolving a length from an inset, we use a length resolver, which

in turn requires a reference to the subject's style. When the subject

is not attached to the document, its style is not calculated and we

had a null deref. To avoid this problem, we verify that the subject

has a style before using the length converter. We handle the trivial

cases of a literal px or percent inset, and otherwise fall back to

marking the inset as being style dependent, in which case, it needs to

be resolved on each style update.





Bug: 1428965

Change-Id: I870d20a72d6dfd9cb787132022545442150d1ecb

entry.title: [Payments] Stub virtual card enrollment bottom sheet bridge
entry.content:
Before this patch, Android always showed an infobar UI for virtual card

enrollment.



This patch adds a stub Android bridge for virtual card enrollment, which

is used when the following flag is enabled:

chrome://flags/#autofill-enable-payments-android-bottom-sheet



After this patch, if the flag is enabled, then Android will use the

stub bottom sheet bridge class for virtual card enrollment. The stub

Android bridge has no UI and no implementation.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Bot is not spotting the coverage on Android.

entry.title: [gc] Apply MPC and inheritance directly in ComputedStyle's constructor.
entry.content:
Currently, when creating a new ComputedStyle object, we would be

first setting provisional subgroup pointers (based on the UA initial

style), and then overwrite parts of it using inheritance and MPC data.

For instance, for the worst-case situation of a partial MPC hit,

we could see something like this:



1. Construct the object; increase the refcount of all subgroups.

2. Call InheritFrom() with the parent; decrease the refcount of

all the subgroups we used to have, increase the refcount of

all the newly copied subgroups.

3. Look up in the MPC, and find the partial hit.

4. Call InheritFrom() with the returned style from MPC; decrease

the refcount of all the subgroups _again_, and instead increase

the refcount of the newly copied ones.



While the above is written in terms of refcounts, the motivation for

this patch is to make it cheaper to move towards having ComputedStyle

on Oilpan, where we have a very similar problem with subobject Member<>

pointer changes creating GC barriers (which can hit a slow path) --

with the important exception that no barriers can happen if the pointer

is set _during the constructor_ (because the ComputedStyle does not

exist yet, so it could not possibly be in the process of being traced

by a background thread). Thus, we want to move as much as possible of

this work into the constructor, setting the subgroup pointers once

there and then be done with it. (Of course, any later Set* would be

modifying the pointers as part of copy-on-write; this is something we

can only fix by moving fully towards a build-once pattern, which this

patch does not attempt.)



Thus, we replace InheritFrom() and CopyNonInheritedFromCached()

with a completely new constructor patterns, which takes in styles

to take inherited and non-inherited subgroups from, and merge the

subgroups in the constructors as needed. (The only real edge case

here is the SVG subgroup, which contains a mix of inherited and

non-inherited properties, so we need to merge that recursively

in the same way.) This means we cannot construct a ComputedStyle

until after the MPC lookup has happened -- this also means that

a lot of the old code which assumed a provisional ComputedStyle

existed (sometimes with certain properties already being set,

sometimes just assuming they were at the UA initial values)

had to be cleaned up, which has happened in some of the previous

patches.



This also fixes the issue where reset_on_new_style (formerly

custom_copy) fields in raredata groups would not be correctly

reset when creating a new style.



Style perftest (Zen 2, LTO but no PGO):

entry.title: WebUI: Migrate chrome://chrome-signin/ tests to WebUIMochaBrowserTest.
entry.content:
As part of the migration, the tests can now directly refer to the signin_metrics::Reason C++ enum which was previously not possible.



Also in order to accommodate the ash::features::kLacrosOnly feature

flag, added some additional test setup in a dedicated

LacrosOnlyMochaBrowserTest class, which might be moved directly in

WebUIMochaBrowserTest in the future. Similar setup exists in JavaScriptBrowserTest and WebUIBrowserTest classes which were used

previously.



WebUIMochaBrowserTest is the new way of running WebUI tests without any

dependency to the obsolete js2gtest and test_api.js mechanism.

entry.title: [ProfileKeyedServiceFactory] Test to force creation of services for System Profile
entry.content:
Enhance the detection of services created for irregular profiles through

the browser tests by forcing the creation of the services, instead of

relying on the services that are only created on Profile Initialization.



This way we make sure that each factory will have to properly define

its profile type scope, and not rely on run time exceptions for validity.



Only issue remains with components/ factory that cannot yet have a way

to differentiate profile types.



Bug: 1284664

entry.title: [bookmarks] Delete sync-ed bookmarks if recently restored from backup
entry.content:
The new logic is guarded behind feature flags (one of which is a

dedicated kill switch).



The approach is based on the following design:

1) Upon construction of BookmarkSyncService, in the factory, it can

be determined reliably whether this browser startup corresponds to

a state that was just restored from a backup (Apple's backup, since

this patch is specific to ios/). The outcome is plumbed through in

the form a newly-introduced enum, WipeModelUponSyncDisabledPolicy,

that generalizes a previously-existing boolean for similar reasons.



2) Depending on what the user does in the initial interactions

(immediately following the restore-from-backup), the browser may

remain signed in (theoretical only, because in practice the user

would never be fast enough) or sign out.



3) For the latter case, SyncService would find itself stopped and invoke

each datatype's ClearMetadataWhileStopped(), with the original goal

to avoid left-behind sync metadata for signed-out users.



4) This particular cleanup logic is intercepted, specifically for

bookmarks, in TriggerWipeModelUponSyncDisabledPolicy(), and the

local bookmarks are deleted because they must have been uploaded to

the user account (and could otherwise lead to duplicates).



Change-Id: I45ee74af49fd61a5c1ecca43253b4525c4d03f28

Bug: 1468502

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727928
